Took a spin with the game and experience was quite average to me.

Casually speaking, game is very fun with friends. If group of 5 can get together and are all at same level, then experience is truly amazing.

On competetive/matchmaking note however, player is less likely to get very far in matchmaking unless he is willing to put atleast 250 hours minimum into it(purely assuming). Gameplay can become redundant and repetetive very easyly. Perk system is built with quantity of time in mind. It takes a lot of time to earn all the perks you need to be able to stay in meta. Low ranked matchmakers usually have better perks and items than new player himself. Skill and experience play vital role only if player and opponent have almost similiar perk sets and experinece.

I can recommend this game for casual playing and having fun with friends, but not for matchmaking.

I would say, game deserves 6/10
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06.12.2021 review

As more killers and survivors have been introduced, the core of the game has stayed the same. Due to the stagnated playerbase, all survivors are pretty much running meta and "second chance" perks. Same goes for killers if they have them. Because Survivors are reskins of each other, killers remain unique, thus making it harder for killers to have proper perks to help kill all 4 survivors. Survivors themselves have all necessary perks when unlocking just 1 or 2 characters. Killers will need atleast 2-4 to have any sort of chance if player is new to the game. And grinding shards to unlock new characters take awful long time.

As a survivor, new players focus on generators while experienced old players fool around with flashlights and pallets around the map. It is not uncommon to see the games finish within 5 minutes or so.
As a killer, new players tend to follow same survivor while experienced killers use all sorts of anti-generator perks and survivor locating perks (perk based wallhacks).

Because of matchmaking changes, it is very easy to make it to rank 1 on either side if you got proper perks and some bit of experience. Thats why its hard to tell, if players are actually good and experienced or just new. Sometimes you see a 7k hour survivor as silver rank while 200 hour killer is Iridecent 1 rank. It is very inconsistent and you will never run across players of your own skill level. The games are either stomp or be stomped.

After reaching Rank 1 as both Survivor and killer, you will realize, how limited you actually are without having unlocked all survivors and killers. Meaning that you are unable to experiment new builds to keep the game fresh for yourself, forcing you to burn out wayyy too quickly. Or if you are rich enough to buy all DLC for real money (Around 150â‚¬ or so) then good luck, as you still need to unlock the perks themselves AND hope that you get the best perks for your favourite killer after unlocking them. Same can be said for survivors ("Decisive Strike" most likely).

If you have friends to play and have fun with, playing Dead by Daylight is a blast! Solo it gets dull too quickly and makes you unmotivated, once you make it to Rank 1.

Experience with friends: 8/10
Experience alone: 5/10

Good game until it isn't. Gets repetitive and stale VERY quick. Survivors are hardly any different from each other (some exceptions) and even less so when you unlock their specific perks for other characters (same could be said for killers, but they inherently are different from each other due to their specific abilities).
Lack of other game modes and innovative ideas for maps and gameplay loop make it go from a great co-op game to a chore.

twitch.tv/Parklis here. Just have to say that I've been playing since beta and I still LOVE this game! Yes, the community can be toxic, and yes, it does get annoying until ded servers next year, but it's still a fun game.

NEW KILLER: LEGION!!
Pros- 
*Pretty fun to play. I like the new perks, however Mad Grit doesn't help to much. 
*Can make tracking survivors easier while in Feral Frenzy with "Killer Intinct" (revealing the location of all Survivors who do not have the Deep Wound Status Effect applied and are within The Legion's Terror Radius"
*Fun as a killer to Vault and not just smash everything
*Can apply HUGE pressure if tagging survivors all the time
*Can choose male or female version based on cosmetics
*Finally have a locker perk

Cons-
*Pretty slow at downing people in a timely manner
*Mad Grit can make some interesting plays if survivors are super altruistic
*Shorter killer so FOV is lower and harder to track as well as others (aka Huntress)
*Can't chain power to down tagged survivors easily

I would put him in the lower-mid tier of killer. Fun to play, but hard to main and get consistent high rank with. Will need some re-work to keep up with the better killers.

My god this game is great. I often spend myself putting hours of my time into it. It can get boring after a while, but new killers and maps every couple of months help to keep things intersting. Also, this game alows you to play as classic horror movie characters such as Michael Myers, Freddy Kreuger, and Leatherface. What's even better is those characters keep their classic movie chase themes (except Freddy, this one is from that crappy 2010 remake). Along with horror movie characters, this game also features Bill from Left 4 Dead, which is just awsome. The only bad part about this game is that some survivors from horror movies don't look anything like their actors, and when comparing it to the accuracy of Friday the 13th: The Game's characters and the winner is obvious. Other than that, this game is amazing and I would highly recommend buying it.

EDIT: After obtaining simultaneous Rank 1 Survivor and Killer i'm done. This game is a hot mess and so is the community, avoid.

Now with the new DLC out i have to sadly change my recommendation...it's gone downhill to put it nicely. for starters the pipping system is not too bad per say, it is the fact that too many variables on both sides influence the game too greatly. and those things for different reasons should and should not influence the game into thinking you are a good or bad player. For example if you play killer and kill everyone in the first 2 minutes of the game by slugging them or something, that should mean you are a good killer and award a pip but sadly it doesn't. Or another, if you are a survivor and you get tunneled off hook that shouldn't mean you are a bad survivor you just got unlucky and its by factors you rarely control. Now on to the biggest problem i see right now....THE F***ing disconnects by lag are insane atm. Almost every game now I disconnect out of the blue due to some sort of lag when i wouldn't experience any leading up to it, or as killer constantly 2 people DC the exact same time due to lag when talking to the other people in the end of game chat they didn't even notice. Now i have been playing this game for a very long time and while yes my internet sometimes has a lag spike every once in a while but the game goes on with no DCs and it eventually reverts to normal but it seems to be that the game is just randomly kicking people and to be honest i cant tell anymore if it is lag at all. To put the icing on the cake DC greatly affects if you pip or not so with people DC left and right i am wrongly de pipped due to some game issue. The killer is great love the Plague and her map. Great addition to the game, but the changes that has come along with her greatly puts this DLC as among the worst in Dead by Daylight History.

So I used to love playing this game a while ago. I stopped playing for a little bit as I was getting to rank 1 pretty quickly and rank 1 is just no fun, its only full of try hards. I came back after I saw the new chapter come out. I liked the idea of this new killer and I wanted to learn this killer, playing this killer was okay I guess. I think I got 1 kill with them as I dont really know how to play them. I do like the mori tho, best one by far. So far the killer is pretty cool I like them yet the perks could of been better tho. Same with the survivor but breakdown seems pretty cool if you are gonna be tunnled off the hook. Now that brings me to the next point I'm going to make. Tunneling is a main thing with this game, also camping. I pretty much get tunneled all the time, its even worse in the higher ranks. Its the only way killers know how to play it seems. Camping well, you have ds on well most killers love to camp if you have that one perk. Now before many people comment on this and say what about toxic survivors dont worry I'm about to talk about them. Survivors yes they can be toxic. Survivors with flashlights, if they know how to use them you bet they will blind you when ever they can. Yes I use a flshlight a lot but I only use them on killers that like to tunnel or camp, but I mostly will use them to save people as thats what they are meant for. But dont get toxicness mixed up with good players. I know to some killers survivors that teabag or pointing can be seen as toxic, and I can see why it is annoying when they just sit there doing that stuff. Now onto this new update that we have, yes the killer and survivor are pretty cool and its nice to see this new change but a long with all this is so many bugs and I mean there is so many I have not seen this many bugs in one game this bad before like wtf happened to the game. Yes they have taken the new map down to fix it as people have been reporting that they have been crashing due to that one map and I'm glad to see they are trying to fix that but lets be honest now they won't fix it as they never fix things. They say they do but they never fix it right. Like the bug where you couldnt move at all, many killers took advantage of that bug. They said they fixed it but it was never fixed took them over a month to fix that bug. I thought that was bad but these bugs we are getting now are even worse. Killers not been seen at all and getting hit from out of no where by a killer you cant see. Putting a pallet down and slidding around the map. Oh there is many more I can list too. But this review is all ready getting long enough. Now the new map? well I cant say much about it as I havent got to play on it just yet as I never got the chance to get it and they have taken it down so who knows when we will get it back so I can see how the new map is. So now I have said all the bad what about the good? Well I guess the only good thing anout this game is I've met some really great people on this game. Really good friends. So I guess this game is only good for playing with your friends or meeting new friends. KYF (Kill Your Friends) Is pretty good fun to just mess about with and have all the perks so you dont have to grind all the perks. So if you want to get this game, make sure you have some friends to play with so you can play KYF. Now SWF is okay I guess if you want to play lobby simulator for an hour or until a killer isnt scared of a 4 or 3 man or even a 2 man yes killers will leave if there is even 2 SWF. So all around thoughts? Well I think I'm gonna be uninstalling until they can fix this game or do something with it. So go a head and buy this game if you want to try and find the game inside all these bugs. But what I would say is to not buy this game. I think it will only get worse then it already is. So "pretty good job so far" if I dont say so myself :)
zzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzz so boring

Aight, first off, sure, I do not have nearly as many hours as some more dedicated players do, am not as good as the "Pros". But the amount of bugs and issues the game has, with 0 attention to them from devs. And then when they claim to have "fixed" a bug, it's still there. Really takes the fun out of playing it alone.

And latest addition to the game is microtransactions. Buy Auric Cells to get cosmetics that all look like they ripped them off of some premade templates on their design software. Just terrible quality and design. Then again, it is cosmetics, so that is just a personal opinion matter. The idea of cosmetics is nice, just wish they fixed their bug riddled game first

The game can however give you some good laughs and moments with friends when you do not take it too seriously. 

Looking at how much attention they give to pumping out cosmetics for more money, and not fixing even the minor bugs that they claim to fix, the game just feels like a cash grab. Latest addition being the "Cursed Legacy", was the last straw. Choosing to give out the Auric cell purchases before the actual character are available on dlc (btw, original characters that you have to pay for, which before Clowns release they promised wouldn't happen) 

Get it only if you have friends, and it's on a huge sale, otherwise, skip on this buggy mess

P.S. If you are looking for a competitive game, don't bother, this game really fits just casual friend groups looking to have a fun time messing with some buggy "game" that charges way more for the ability to have any fun than the initial price tag indicates
